items.title: Backend Engineer - Driver Experience at Heetch (Paris, France)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=5, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=9, go=8, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=2, apple=2, java=1, gamedev=8, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Carsharing, Marketplace, Transportation
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Technologies

dockergoelixirruby-on-railspostgresql

Job description

*** Heetch offers remote first positions for its Technical team which means you can be based in Paris or anywhere else you want in Europe like 90% of our tech team.

 We are still a young structure and we are not ready to work with people outside EU for timezone considerations but will keep you posted on that ;)***

DRIVER EXPERIENCE TEAM @HEETCH

The top priority of our user-driven team is the happiness of our drivers. From the moment they decide to join us until they enter our marketplace, drivers will be using our products. And our mission is to make sure they get the stellar experience they deserve.

Given our very large business scope(drivers acquisition, retention and well-being), our team is working side by side with frontend, mobile, product and design teams, allowing us to build features that will empower drivers with new ways to drive and earn.

From the inside, we’re a caring full-stack team of engineers(IOS, Android, Frontend, Backend, QA) who share the same values:

• Transparency: We discuss everything openly.

• Team Unity : No one is left behind.

• Move Fast : No need to demonstrate for day, just do it.

• Knowledge Sharing : Whether it's organizational, cultural or tech, we're eager to learn!

• It's OK to fail : Succeed together, learn together.

With the many new challenges we’re facing every day, our team is seeking a product aficionado that will help us take our services to the next level. Our ideal candidate is someone who loves building softwares people genuinely love using, have strong problem-solving skills and great empathy for users.

What Happens Next Will Surprise You !

CHALLENGES YOU’LL BE FACING WITH US

• Design a flexible driver onboarding flow allowing our international team to easily launch new cities.

• Provide an optimized solution for company executives to manage their fleet.

• Build tools that significantly improve our communication with our drivers.

RESPONSIBILITIES

• Deploy, monitor and maintain your microservices in production.

• Design well-tested, and scalable software to handle millions of users.

• Participate in Code Reviews and provide feedback to your colleagues.

• Leave code better than you found it.

• Create a positive environment for the people around you.

• Lead by example.

• Share knowledge with your team and help them grow.

REQUIREMENTS

• Solid experience as a Backend Engineer.

• Comfortable building softwares in a polyglot environment (Ruby or Elixir).

• Delivers elegant APIs that are easy to use.

• Designs performant systems for high throughput workloads.

• Awareness and understanding of technical constraints.

• Not afraid of leaving your technical comfort zone.

• Bonus : Knowledge in Event Driven Design or DDD, CQRS+ES, Golang

PERKS

• Stocks.

• Paid conference attendance/travel.

• Heetch credits.

• A Spotify subscription.

• Medical care.

• Code retreats and company retreats.

• Travel budget (visit your remote coworkers and our offices).

Apply now

Benefits

  • Full remote (in Europe only) and flexible ways of working
  • Paid conferences attendance/travel
  • Periodic team meetups
  • Stocks
  • Heetch credits

items.title: Mobile Game Unity Developer [REMOTE]
tags: DBG:surround``OR(pacif, pst, pdt, western, california, losangel, sanfrancisco, paloalto, sanmateo) 3W OR(time,timezon)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=26, c=4, mobile=54, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=1, gamedev=80, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Mobile Game Unity Developer [REMOTE] - Jobmote

Mobile Game Unity Developer [REMOTE]

Fox Cub

Job Description

Our team is looking for a results oriented Unity Mobile Game Developer to help take our game "Sega Slots" to the next level. You will work with designers and artists to create new features and content in the game, as well as fix bugs, improve performance, and write tools to improve the efficiency of the team. This is a full-time remote position.

Responsibilities:

  • Create brand new slot machines, mini games, and other features from design docs, and make design decisions yourself based on user experience and game design best practices
  • Write solid and reusable code that fits into our existing Slots engine and adheres to our style guide
  • Work with the design & art teams to figure out what they want, and offer guidance based on what is possible in Unity
  • Improve workflows by making custom inspector panels or Unity Editor windows
  • We don't care where you are in the world, but you must be able to consistently work 9am-5pm Pacific Time, Mon-Fri

Qualifications:

  • Be an excellent C# programmer with good knowledge of Unity internals
  • Understand and identify good user experience, good visuals, and good game design
  • Design and write simple algorithms, and choose appropriate data structures
  • Animate things via the Unity Animator, coroutines, and tweens
  • Good knowledge of UGUI (Unity Gui), Sprite Renderer, and 2D workflows
  • Tweak & adjust particle systems as well as hook up VFX from artists
  • Good with Git
  • Familiarity of games, mobile games, and mobile devices
  • Fluent in spoken English and willing to talk on voice chat to collaborate with co-workers
  • Bonus skill: Integrate new native code iOS / Android plugins into our Unity project
  • Bonus skill: Understand mobile performance bottlenecks and suggest/implement changes to improve performance
  • Bonus skill: create shaders to achieve a specific 2D visual effect
  • Bonus skill: experience creating web-applications with .NET & C#
  • Bonus skill: knowledge of Slots

We collaborate online with Slack, Teamspeak, Github, Dropbox, and Google Docs.

Company DescriptionOur entire company is work from home! We were founded on the principle that having control over when and where you work is essential for happiness. All of us take advantage of flexible hours to deal with life when it happens - whether that's spending time with your kids after school, medical appointments, or just friends visiting from out of town during the day.

We don't think that a great job should require you to uproot your life and your family, or that a life event should force you out of a great job. We want to work with great people no matter where your life takes you.

The development process is very collaborative. You will have a strong voice in deciding what we do, even gameplay and design.

Our culture is very open and transparent. We work hard to empowered everyone to make decisions and affect change.

items.title: Type/Code: Senior Digital Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=8, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Full-time

(Brooklyn, NY)

We are looking for an exceptionally talented Senior UI/UX/Digital Designer to join our growing team of creatives and coders on a full-time basis at our studio in DUMBO, Brooklyn. While an on-site teammate is preferrable, we will consider remote applicants.

 

About Type/Code:

 

Type/Code designs and builds digital products and experiences, working with ambitious clients to bring powerful ideas to life. Our clients range from technology startups (Architizer), to cultural institutions (MIT Media Lab, MoMA), to large media properties (GOOD); and we often collaborate with large companies such as Google, GE, and Scholastic. We focus on conceiving, designing, and developing exceptional digital experiences across a wide range of mediums. While a significant amount of our work is client focused, we jump at any opportunity to build self-driven tools and products. Our studio atmosphere is friendly, laid-back, collaborative, flexible, and full of a passionate group of designers and developers who love what they do.

 

Role:

 

You will be working closely with our design and development teams on a range of project types—focusing on web platforms, mobile applications, and digital communication design—along with opportunities to participate in branding, print design, data visualization, motion graphics, and more. You will be involved in the entire lifecycle of our projects: from strategy and design research, to prototyping and iterating on design solutions, to the execution of final design deliverables in close collaboration with our development team.

 

You have:

 

  • 4+ years of experience art directing and designing for digital mediums, specifically user interface design for websites and web applications, across a wide range of devices
  • A portfolio demonstrating creative, impactful, and effective design solutions, across an adaptable range of mediums and styles
  • Effective communication skills—including presenting design strategies to teammates, clients, and stakeholders, and leading design-centric conversations
  • Exceptional typography, composition, hierarchy, and color theory capabilities
  • Ability to strategize with and art direct creative collaborators such as photographers and illustrators when needed
  • A strong understanding of User Experience fundamentals, and a passion for designing digital experiences that are beautiful, intuitive, and a joy to engage with
  • Experience with design research, finding precedents, assembling type, image, and color studies, and rapidly prototyping and iterating on design solutions
  • A mastery of Sketch, Adobe’s Creative Suite (especially Photoshop and Illustrator), InVision, and hunger for continually exploring new design tools and processes with. After Effects/animation experience is a huge plus
  • A cursory understanding of HTML/CSS/JS (the more frontend development skills the better), and a desire to influence/understand how the things you design will be built
  • Experience with working on a distributed team (thriving under collaborative workflows with multiple teammates and disciplines when needed), and ability to produce complex design deliverables with minimal guidance

If this sounds like you, we would love to look through your work and chat some more.

Job Perks: - Competitive salary- Central location in sunny DUMBO Brooklyn with a beautiful view of Manhattan- Regularly stocked snacks, coffee, and beer- Bike and pet friendly- Work machine of your choosing- Health, dental, and vision insurance- Education/Professional Growth stipend - Flexible hours and work-from-home policy

Apply: Send a brief cover letter and a link to your portfolio website to jobs@typecode.com

items.title: Full Stack Developer - Specializing in Web Performance at Ceros
tags: DBG:surround``remot 3N OR(options, avail, allow) NOT encourag
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=23, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=16, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=23}
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Advertising Technology, Content Marketing, Publishing
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: VC Funded

Technologies

javascriptphp

Job description

Position Type: Full Time

Location: Remote · Allows Remote

Team: Product Team

Company overview

The Ceros platform empowers designers and marketers to create and publish beautiful, interactive content experiences without the need for developers.

Our users work collaboratively in real-time on a browser-based digital canvas to create pixel-perfect experiences with rich animations and interactivity. The experiences they publish work consistently across all browsers and devices, and all customer engagement is tracked with extensive analytics. All without writing code.

About the Product

Designing and building the Ceros platform is not an easy task. We require the best-of-the-best web developers, designers, and QA testers, ready to bring the functionality of desktop software to the web, often pushing web browsers to the limits of what’s currently possible.

Our codebase is 95% JavaScript and the Ceros product is comprised of multiple single-page applications with a client-heavy focus. We use libraries like jQuery, Require, and Backbone. The Ceros Studio is architected around the HTML5 Canvas element.

We’re not language zealots. We believe in using the right tool for the job, and our current server-side infrastructure runs PHP, Node.js, Redis, AWS Aurora, Chef, etc. on the Amazon AWS cloud.

About the Team

As part of the Ceros product team, you’ll be working with a small, cross-functional group of the most talented people you’ve ever worked with. We hire only passionate and creative people with a proven and unquestionable ability to execute, and every member of the team is equally responsible for moving the product forward.

We have a dynamic company culture that collaborates daily. We care deeply about the user experience, and we debate passionately about our ideas. When you work at Ceros, you check your ego at the door, and you aren’t afraid to be honest, especially to yourself. We take our jobs seriously but ourselves not so much -- whether it’s cracking jokes in the chat room or poking fun at the CEO’s atrocious spelling.

About the Job

Working completely from home, you’ll be communicating often through chat rooms, email, and video conferencing. We offer flexible working hours and an extremely flexible vacation policy. And we provide excellent gear (15” Macbook Pro, iPad, external monitor, etc.).

We believe that every piece of content created within Ceros is an experience. As such, we strive for the user’s experience to be as smooth as possible. To achieve this, we need developers with a passion for web performance. We’re looking for people with experience profiling javascript applications and squeezing every last millisecond out of the code. We want somebody that is knowledgeable in web performance best practices and strives to make code faster.

Desired experience:

  • Object-oriented programming
  • Image & video asset optimization (Webp, Adaptive bitrate streaming, etc.)
  • Asset preloading
  • Efficient use of caches
  • Building performant web animations
  • HTTP/2 protocol to streamline loading
  • Impress us with anything else you have experience with!

As a developer, your typical day-to-day involves:

  • writing maintainable code (probably goes without saying),
  • having your day ruined by functional QA testers who find every bug you write,
  • carrying out and being on the receiving end of intense code review sessions from your peers who hold your work (and their own) at the highest of standards,
  • agonizing over the user experience until even a trained monkey could use the product,
  • collaborating with and mentoring your peers on security best practices,
  • and finally, deploying your code to production and seeing the customer create something amazing and beautiful with it.

Next Steps

If you’re interested in being part of the Ceros team, please send your resume and a cover letter to us. We’re a company of passionate, honest, and sometimes silly people, so don’t be afraid to express yourself.

Apply now

About Ceros

With flexible hours, a generous vacation policy and the best darn coworkers you could ask for, we don't need to resort to bribing new hires with candy from our creepy white van.

Benefits

  • Flexible Vacation Policy
  • Health Insurance
  • Enjoy Your Work
  • Flexible Hours
  • Top-notch Gear
  • Stock Options
  • Work 100% From Home
  • Team meet-ups 3x/year

items.title: 4D Pipeline: Experienced 3D Software Engineers
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(europ, european, europeanunion)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=18, other=0, dotnet=5, c=15, mobile=10, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=24, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Experienced 3D Software Engineers

Posted May 28

4D Pipeline
Headquarters: Silicon Valley, California
www.4dpipeline.com
View all 4D Pipeline jobs →

Come join one of the best teams you can imagine. Work on great projects, getting sh!t done, make products people love!

Having a Great Team has been our simple formula for our success.
We are looking for seasoned and experienced developers who are brilliant at what they do.
In return - we will give you great work, great clients, great team, and a long term great profitable relationship.
You get to work with some of the best Brands and companies in the world, companies like Epic Games, AUDI, AMD, Intel, NVIDIA, IKEA, BMW Mini, VANS, Unity Technology, Xerox PARC, and many others, including fast growing startups. 

You'll be playing a key role in each project and will be continuously learning new technologies and working on cutting edge products. Most of all, you'll enjoy your work and the people you work with and we'll do all that we can to help you meet and exceed your goals.

Conditions:
- Work from anywhere in the world (Europe or Eastern Europe preferred).
- Unless otherwise stated, a minimum of 30 hours per week (ideally 40) - must be able to work week days - not just weekends. If you have a fulltime job please do not apply.
- Must be an individual not an agency/firm.
- As part of our hiring process you will have a video interview and a programming test. 
- Working English required

We are looking for experienced programmers with:
- 3D graphics development experience with a focus on working with OpenGL/DirectX/WebGL, and 3D engines. 
- Ideally with Virtual Reality and/or Augmented Reality experience. 
- Strong bonus to have Unity or Unreal Engine experience 
- Bonus to have mobile experience 
- Bonus to have WebGL experience 
- Bonus to have Shader experience 
- Bonus to have Raytracing experience Background in games, 3D visualization, or CAD a bonus 
- Bonus to have web experience and/or Django experience (we are also seeking a Django developer) 
- Primarily languages - C++ / C# / Javascript / Python

Any questions - happy to answer.

 

Apply for this position

Please send in your CV and/or LinkedIN profile to:awesomejob@4Dpipeline.comPlease highlight some of your past 3D graphics experience you have.

Mobile Game Unity Developer [REMOTE] - Jobmote

Mobile Game Unity Developer [REMOTE]

Fox Cub

Job Description

Our team is looking for a results oriented Unity Mobile Game Developer to help take our game "Sega Slots" to the next level. You will work with designers and artists to create new features and content in the game, as well as fix bugs, improve performance, and write tools to improve the efficiency of the team. This is a full-time remote position.

Responsibilities:

  • Create brand new slot machines, mini games, and other features from design docs, and make design decisions yourself based on user experience and game design best practices
  • Write solid and reusable code that fits into our existing Slots engine and adheres to our style guide
  • Work with the design & art teams to figure out what they want, and offer guidance based on what is possible in Unity
  • Improve workflows by making custom inspector panels or Unity Editor windows
  • We don't care where you are in the world, but you must be able to consistently work 9am-5pm Pacific Time, Mon-Fri

Qualifications:

  • Be an excellent C# programmer with good knowledge of Unity internals
  • Understand and identify good user experience, good visuals, and good game design
  • Design and write simple algorithms, and choose appropriate data structures
  • Animate things via the Unity Animator, coroutines, and tweens
  • Good knowledge of UGUI (Unity Gui), Sprite Renderer, and 2D workflows
  • Tweak & adjust particle systems as well as hook up VFX from artists
  • Good with Git
  • Familiarity of games, mobile games, and mobile devices
  • Fluent in spoken English and willing to talk on voice chat to collaborate with co-workers
  • Bonus skill: Integrate new native code iOS / Android plugins into our Unity project
  • Bonus skill: Understand mobile performance bottlenecks and suggest/implement changes to improve performance
  • Bonus skill: create shaders to achieve a specific 2D visual effect
  • Bonus skill: experience creating web-applications with .NET & C#
  • Bonus skill: knowledge of Slots

We collaborate online with Slack, Teamspeak, Github, Dropbox, and Google Docs.

Company DescriptionOur entire company is work from home! We were founded on the principle that having control over when and where you work is essential for happiness. All of us take advantage of flexible hours to deal with life when it happens - whether that's spending time with your kids after school, medical appointments, or just friends visiting from out of town during the day.

We don't think that a great job should require you to uproot your life and your family, or that a life event should force you out of a great job. We want to work with great people no matter where your life takes you.

The development process is very collaborative. You will have a strong voice in deciding what we do, even gameplay and design.

Our culture is very open and transparent. We work hard to empowered everyone to make decisions and affect change.

items.title: Mobile Game Unity Developer [REMOTE]
tags: DBG:surround``OR(pacif, pst, pdt, western, california, losangel, sanfrancisco, paloalto, sanmateo) 3W OR(time,timezon)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=26, c=4, mobile=54, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=1, gamedev=80, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Mobile Game Unity Developer [REMOTE] - Jobmote

Mobile Game Unity Developer [REMOTE]

Fox Cub

Job Description

Our team is looking for a results oriented Unity Mobile Game Developer to help take our game "Sega Slots" to the next level. You will work with designers and artists to create new features and content in the game, as well as fix bugs, improve performance, and write tools to improve the efficiency of the team. This is a full-time remote position.

Responsibilities:

  • Create brand new slot machines, mini games, and other features from design docs, and make design decisions yourself based on user experience and game design best practices
  • Write solid and reusable code that fits into our existing Slots engine and adheres to our style guide
  • Work with the design & art teams to figure out what they want, and offer guidance based on what is possible in Unity
  • Improve workflows by making custom inspector panels or Unity Editor windows
  • We don't care where you are in the world, but you must be able to consistently work 9am-5pm Pacific Time, Mon-Fri

Qualifications:

  • Be an excellent C# programmer with good knowledge of Unity internals
  • Understand and identify good user experience, good visuals, and good game design
  • Design and write simple algorithms, and choose appropriate data structures
  • Animate things via the Unity Animator, coroutines, and tweens
  • Good knowledge of UGUI (Unity Gui), Sprite Renderer, and 2D workflows
  • Tweak & adjust particle systems as well as hook up VFX from artists
  • Good with Git
  • Familiarity of games, mobile games, and mobile devices
  • Fluent in spoken English and willing to talk on voice chat to collaborate with co-workers
  • Bonus skill: Integrate new native code iOS / Android plugins into our Unity project
  • Bonus skill: Understand mobile performance bottlenecks and suggest/implement changes to improve performance
  • Bonus skill: create shaders to achieve a specific 2D visual effect
  • Bonus skill: experience creating web-applications with .NET & C#
  • Bonus skill: knowledge of Slots

We collaborate online with Slack, Teamspeak, Github, Dropbox, and Google Docs.

Company DescriptionAbout Fox Cub Games:
Fox Cub Games is a 100% distributed company.
There are no physical offices, everyone works remotely.
Our small team is tight-knit, and our process is collaborative and iterative.
You will have a strong voice in not just on how to market the game, but also on the gameplay and design.

items.title: ModSquad Inc: Community Tier2 Tech Support Associate
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR( australia, japan, newzealand)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=8, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=2}
items.content:
Community Tier2 Tech Support Associate

Posted May 10

ModSquad Inc
Headquarters: Sydney, Australia
www.modsquad.com/join-the-mods
View all ModSquad Inc jobs →

We are looking for a freelance contractor who is an expert in community support and has great customer service experience with an enthusiastic attitude! We currently have one open contract opportunity for 40 hours per week and are seeking a uniquely qualified freelancer to provide services to our remote support team for Vimeo, a leading online video platform. Duties to fill include providing ticket support through Zendesk to assist customers that use the Vimeo platform.

What is needed:
  • A top-notch tech support and customer service ninja who can provide stellar support via email to a full range of members, from casual users to business hosting customers.
  • Someone who can identify recurring customer issues, help to solve them, and escalate them to others for review.
  • An agent who can help track and surface bugs.
  • An agent who will stay up-to-date about the latest issues, feature launches, and policy changes through reading emails from Vimeo’s HQ team.
  • An agent who will suggest new customer response templates and help to write online help documentation.
  • A ninja coffee drinker who will have virtual coffee with us.

What we’re looking for:
  • Amazing written English communication skills!
  • Internet savvy ninja tech skills :)
  • Excellent attention to detail and ability to recognize patterns
  • Great people skills and a desire to learn new things
  • Comfortable following detailed workflows and programs
  • Great people skills and a desire to learn new things
  • Candidates interested in a long-term position only
  • Located in or around Sydney, Australia

Bonus qualifications:
  • You’ve got a leg up if you have customer service experience (and two legs up for online support or community experience)
  • Experience in / passion for film and video is a plus
  • Your family and friends come to you for all their tech support needs

Some of the best things about contracting with us:
  • You can work from your home or anywhere you can find secure highspeed WiFi.
  • Competitive contract rates
  • Our clients are awesome and so are the people that use their products.
  • We live in a never-ending stream of meme references and animated GIFs.

SCHEDULE & Pay Rate:
  • Normal hours are Monday to Friday, 8am-5pm local time.
  • Hourly rate is negotiable depending on experience (minimum is $21/hr USD).


Apply for this position

Apply via www.modsquad.com/join-the-mods

items.title: Baremetrics: Lead Product Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=16, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
Full-time

(Anywhere)

Play a major role in the visual design and experience of Baremetrics. We're looking for a designer who's comfortable with both UI and marketing design who's aware of and able to use design to help users comprehend complex business metrics. The core of this job is data visualization and helping businesses make sense of large amounts of data.

The analytics world is uptight, dry and boring. It lacks joy and personality. You're tasked with changing that. We want customers to use Baremetrics and smile. Design for marketing should tell a story and UI design should lead people towards making better business decisions. We want someone who fully understands and embraces that.

You'll be heading up the entire visual identity and experience of Baremetrics from marketing to UI to branding and everything in between.

About Baremetrics

Baremetrics is a business analytics & insights company. We provide the tools and data businesses need to make solid business decisions.

Founded in 2013, we're working hard to help businesses spend less time crunching numbers and looking at spreadsheets and instead give them instant access to metrics and business insights that they need to run their businesses.

We're not some flash-in-the-pan startup...we're five years old, profitable, doing over $1M in revenue and growing. Nearly 1,000 business from all over the world trust us to help them grow their businesses.

We're looking for folks who like to solve problems and build a business and product that people genuinely love to interact with.

Read about working at Baremetrics: https://baremetrics.com/jobs

 

What we need from you

  • Experience designing, managing and shipping real-world products
  • Strong, opinionated design skills
  • Understanding of the role interaction & animation has in a product and the ability to convey that in the design process
  • Experience making visual sense of large amounts of data (i.e. charts and graphs galore)
  • Basic working knowledge of HTML and CSS
  • Self-starter that doesn't require hand-holding

Some nice-to-have's

 

  • Ability to build out your design work
  • Motion/animation experience
  • Icon and illustration skills

Benefits

  • Work from anywhere (we're 100% remote)
  • Minimum vacation policy
  • Competitive salary ($90,000-$130,000)
  • New computer
  • Stock options
  • Flexible work hours
  • Full health, vision and dental insurance
  • Annual company meetups
  • Kindle Paperwhite + Unlimited Books
  • Monthly "remote stipend" that you can use for anything

Job Perks: Work from anywhere (we're 100% remote)Minimum vacation policyCompetitive salary ($90,000-$130,000)New computerStock optionsFlexible work hoursFull health, vision and dental insuranceAnnual company meetupsKindle Paperwhite + Unlimited BooksMonthly "remote stipend" that you can use for anything

Apply:

items.title: Senior Software Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=5, c=10, mobile=5, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=16, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
JOB TYPE: Full time

LOCATION:
Remote
Anywhere in
North America

EXPERIENCE: intermediate

COMPANY: Ghostly Bear Games; 75-100 employees; 75-100% remote;

SKILLS:
• Video Game Development
• Programming

Ghostly Bear Games (GBG) is seeking our first Senior Engineer to help design and implement an exciting multiplayer game utilizing a combination of modern video game engines and custom code. We are a distributed company so you will be working from home with a multidisciplinary team, digitally attending daily planning meetings, and using collaboration tools to drive your projects forward. The position requires a highly collaborative person, excited to explore multiple technologies relevant to service-based 3D multiplayer games and hands on development of the underlying game systems. As a full stack developer, you will be a key contributor working across both game client and server code as well as building web based tools and interfaces. Your contributions will also enable non technical teams to rapidly produce high quality assets so the company can meet our goals. We feel building a team with a wide set of backgrounds and experiences is key to a healthy and long lived business, so GBG is focused on actively recruiting a diverse workforce.

Responsibilities:
Leadership - You will provide leadership by establishing technical standards, processes, and driving build vs. buy decisions.



Planning - Collaborate with the other teams to define engineering stories for game features, tools, and infrastructure with an accurate estimation of development effort.



Design - You will design complex game and infrastructure systems including multiplayer networking, data platforms, and 3D art pipelines.



Programming - Contribute to development across multiple languages and platforms with a focus on simplicity, maintainability, and security.



Accountability - You will ensure on time delivery of projects through regular communication and collaboration with other teams.



Quality - Craft application frameworks, design patterns, and continuous integration workflows to increase the quality and security of our games.

Basic Qualifications:
The ability to work in multiple programming languages and frameworks depending on the feature or engine (e.g. C++, C#, Python, JavaScript).

Strong familiarity with at least one game engine (e.g. Unreal, Unity, Lumberyard), source code management and software lifecycle challenges.

Highly communicative and inquisitive, driving conversations should be the default.

Direct experience developing and supporting game systems and 3D toolsets.

Who We Are:
Ghostly Bear Games is a small distributed game studio, passionate about building games players want to make their own through creativity and competition. Our employees value developing trust through open discussions, rigorous feedback, and playful exploration.

items.title: Game Programmer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=10, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=16, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Game Programmer at VerAxis

San Francisco, Remote · Full Time
Skills
Unity3D
Compensation
$90K–$130K
1.0%–2.5%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

Great hardcore game coding skills (particularly Unity3d and multiplayer / 2D environments). Capable of tackling big projects whilst getting things done on time.

A highly creative yet robustly analytical mindset is sought for. Strong experience in game data analysis and machine learning will be highly advantageous, as will be a research level background in serious or educational games with a particular interest in learning metrics and adaptive teaching technology for game based learning.
